Etymology
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Dog}} [[File:Coat_types_3.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|犬}} (''inu''): various kinds of '''[[dog]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|いぬ|yomi=k}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=いぬ}}. Derivation uncertain. Various theories exist, including derivation from ancient verb {{m|ja|往ぬ|tr=inu||to leave, to be gone}}, from the way a dog will guard the house while the master is away; from a compound of {{m|ja|家|tr=ie||house, home}} + {{m|ja|寝|tr=nu||to sleep|pos=ancient monosyllabic form of modern {{m|ja|寝る}} ''neru''}}; from ancient Japanese {{m|ja|狗|tr=enu||puppy, dog}}, itself of uncertain derivation; or as a borrowing from some other unknown language.

subSections.title: Noun
